conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, C, and D and needs to be predicted whether it flows into container E or F after passing through baffles.
Container A is blue, B is cyan, C is yellow, and D is orange. Containers E and F are blue and yellow respectively. There are baffles of various colors: black, red, orange, purple, and pink.
Liquid from A flows straight down and encounters the horizontal black baffle.
The black baffle deflects the blue liquid to the left, causing it to flow downward into container E.
Liquid from B flows down and to the right, hitting the red baffle.
The red baffle directs the cyan liquid downward, causing it to flow straight into container E.
Liquid from C flows down and to the right, hitting the red baffle.
The red baffle directs the yellow liquid downward, causing it to flow past the orange baffle into container E.
Liquid from D flows down and to the right, encountering the purple baffle.
The purple baffle directs the orange liquid slightly downward, causing it to flow into container F.
Liquids from A, B, and C flow into container E, while liquid from D flows into container F.
Final answer: The liquid flows into both containers E and F, with E receiving liquids from A, B, and C, and F receiving liquid from D.
